nodes.bodyText: I noticed that UniqueKeyBase implements Serializable, probably don't have to reimplement here.
nodes.diffHunk:

nodes.bodyText: Check for valid entrezGeneIds before reference (should this be done upstream?).
nodes.diffHunk:

             <foreach item="item" collection="molecularProfileIds" open="(" separator="," close=")">
                 #{item}
             </foreach>
-            AND (structural_variant.SITE1_ENTREZ_GENE_ID in

-                #{item}
-            </foreach>
-            OR structural_variant.SITE2_ENTREZ_GENE_ID IN

-                #{item}
-            </foreach>
-            )

nodes.bodyText: When a fusion is carried within a mutation record, the protein change contains the SV event.
Not sure if it's a SV event but the protein change is SV. Here is an example https://www.cbioportal.org/patient?studyId=nbl_broad_2013&caseId=TARGET-30-PANRRW
I checked, its over here ImportFusionData
Is this when a gene symbol is not found?  Should we note that site2 is not being set here?
Yes. I'll add a comment here
This will go away once we move to a more structured SV format.
